subtitle: hi I'm Simon Jacobson this is meaningful
Monday's where we answer your personal
questions this week's question is about
children and money I've heard differing
opinions and how and on what age to
speak to kids about money well I don't
want this still stress or feelings of
limitation in them I do feel strongly
that we should discuss fiscal
responsibility with our kids at some
point what are your recommendations on
this topic well frankly the later the
better children by nature have no clue
what money is actually tested it
recently with my granddaughter six years
old and they called her over and I said
to her Luba how would you like if I gave
you a gift of one hundred million
dollars and she literally turned her
back on me and ran away and I said I'll
give you a coloring book peak of a doll
or some other toy that she identifies
with she would have hugged me and kissed
me and tried to buy me off every
possible way so I was thinking to myself
is this something wrong with us adults
or something wrong with her and I think
it's an obvious answer children and
money don't relate to each other because
money is a superficial superimposed
reality that adults seem to need to
worship or replace or compensate for

everything
